textos_fuente.text: Town and Country Mobile RV Service » About Us Home Services About Us Contact Specials Parts Store Used Parts About Us Town & Country Mobile RV was established in 2004 by Barry & Claudia Smith, who combined have over 40 years of experience in the RV industry. We have RVIA certified technicians to provide any service, repair or maintenance your RV may need. To try and accommodate all of our customers needs we offer on site service calls with our mobile technicians anywhere within our service area. We also offer warranty work for many manufacturers and can work with your insurance company or your extended warranty company. We service all brands of motorhomes, fifth wheels, travel trailers and horse trailers. We have an A+ rating with the BBB because of the quality and care we give our customers. "Town & Country Mobile RV diagnosed our refrigeration problem, refrigerator had trouble staying cold on hot days, and replaced a faulty thermostat. They also did a Norcold refrigerator recall fix. So far, so good! Barry is extremely professional and quick. Showed up at our RV Site when he said he would and diagnosed the problem. Parts were needed, and were ordered and installed in the promised time frame. We will use him again if we need RV repairs in the Memphis area."  -Tom S BBB Accredited RIVA Certified Technicians Designed and Hosted by Smart Website Creations

Staff — Town & Country RV Resort Skip to the content (813) 892-1474 Dade City, Florida Tampa 74 ° f Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact Book A Stay Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact Our Staff Meet the Family The Town and Country RV Resort is family owned and operated by the Hawkins family since 2000. Steve Hawkins OWNER/MAINTENANCE MANAGER Steve has worked in the RV and Mobile Home business for 55 years, since 1968. He excels at maintaining the park property, continuously improving the facilities and roads and always finds new varieties of plants, trees and bamboo to add to the landscaping. Mary Hawkins OFFICE MANAGER Mary has worked in the RV and Mobile Home business for 47 years, since 1976. She is very knowledgeable about the Dade City area and can provide numerous ideas to residents looking to take day trips around Florida. David Hawkins PARK MAINTENANCE David has worked in the RV and Mobile Home business for 39 years, since 1984, when he began accompanying his father to the parts store at the age of 5. He works with his father daily, trimming trees, laying blacktop, maintaining the pool or painting the community buildings. He is an avid mountain biker and also enjoys working with metal. Kim Hawkins WEB PRESENCE & SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING Kim has helped out with the website design and content since 2008 and also posts about park news and events related to Town & Country RV Resort on the Facebook and Instagram pages. We work hard every day so you can safely enjoy your retirement years. Come Stay With Us All Town & Country RV sites are full hook-up and have either 30 or 50 amp service (50 amp available on all sites).  All of our sites are very spacious at 75 feet long and we have no limitations on RV length. Pull through lots in the back can house RVs pulling trailers. RENTAL DETAILS Town & Country RV Resort Town & Country RV Resort is a seasonal 55+ community located 4 miles north of downtown Dade City amidst the rolling hills of Western Central Florida. Contact Us 18005 US-301, Dade City, FL 33523 (813) 892-1474 (Main) (352) 567-7707 (Alt) E-mail us Winter and summer office hours vary. Please call for more info. Reply to this review Book now View Website Location 7555 Shilling Rd, West Salem, OH 44287 Coordinates: 40.937810, -82.100830 Directions From Jct of I-71 & SR-539 (exit 198), NW 1.2 mi on SR-539 to Shilling Rd, N 1 mi (E) Get directions From $35 / night Book now View Website Previous Next How to read Good Sam Ratings The three-number rating that accompanies each campground listing in the directory gives readers an at-a-glance assessment of a campground's amenities, cleanliness and environment. All three ratings categories are measured on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best. Less than 1 percent of parks or campgrounds receive the coveted 10 | 10 | 10 rating, which indicates superior facilities that are well maintained, clean, well-appointed restrooms and a highly appealing appearance. Campgrounds are inspected annually by dedicated RVers like you. Completeness of facilities 10 10 10 The first campground rating evaluates completeness and quality of facilities. In this category we rate interior roads, sites, registration area, hookups, recreation, swimming, security, laundry, store and building maintenance. Cleanliness of restrooms and showers 10 10 10 The second rating category concerns the cleanliness and physical characteristics of toilets, walls, showers, sinks/counters/mirrors and floor. If a park achieves a full point in each of the above, it receives a star ( ), indicating exceptionally clean restrooms. Also rated are physical characteristics of restrooms, including interior construction, adequate supplies/odor free, adequate number of facilities, exterior appearance and location in relation to park spaces, and interior appearance. Visual appeal and environmental quality 10 10 10 This category addresses the park's setting and site layout, function and identification of signage, overall exterior building maintenance, noise, trash disposal, litter and debris around the grounds and sites, and appearance of grounds, sites and entrance area. If a park complies with 3 or more items from the following list, a special green designation will show in their listing. Non-toxic cleaning products Natural pest control (most of the time) Minimized the use of styrofoam and significantly reduce the use of plastic Landscape managers use appropriate irrigation systems and drought tolerant and indigenous plants Recycling cans for the RVers Changed light bulbs to compact fluorescent lights (CFLs) Insulated water heaters Lowered pool temperatures Installed photocells (solar) Use more fuel efficient vehicles Instead of golf carts, implemented a strategy of encouraging the use of bikes and trikes Tankless water heaters Composting What makes this park family friendly? Lots are rented for park models, travel trailers or motorhomes. During the season, residents enjoy day trips on their trikes or motorcycles, chair yoga in the Rec Hall, morning walks through the park, special occasion dances, pancake breakfasts, social time around the fire pit and guitar jam sessions. Additionally, enjoy park activities and events all season. Seasoned Furnished Rentals CALL FOR PRICE (SIX MONTH SEASON) Plus electric, no tax included We own and maintain a few fully furnished rental units each year. This is a great way to try out our park for a season or two before you commit to a new home away from home. There is a monthly customer service charge, which is customary on most electric bills in the US. Water All water in the Town and Country RV Resort is Florida well water, treated by Pasco County and included in the pricing for all of our packages. Internet Typically, residents set up services through Century Link, billed monthly, but ask around as other providers have appeared recently: Verizon Mobile Hotspots, ViaSat, Satellite Internet and Starlink for RV. Cable Cable TV or Satellite TV is through Century Link or Direct TV, but check around for other options. Sewage All lots have sewer connections and the park has its own independent wastewater treatment plant. Our sewage services are included in the pricing for all of our packages. Trash & Recycling Dumpsters are provided for trash and paper recycling. We encourage residents to recycle paper and cardboard products but food contaminated trash and bottles are not allowed in the paper dumpster. See the dumpster or the office for a list of acceptable paper products. MAKE A RESERVATION Services From Local Companies Wireless Internet Please contact Century Link if you want to purchase your own internet service. Land Phone Line Please contact Century Link for LandLine Phone Services. If you have your own wireless router, you can also purchase internet service through Century Link. Satellite To access a satellite network while you’re staying with us, please contact Direct TV or Dish Network for Dade City, Florida. Propane For all your propane needs while you’re staying with us, please contact Bahr's Propane or AmeriGas. Amenities At Town & Country RV Resort we offer a wide variety of amenities for our guests. All amenities are serviced regularly and ready for use. About Us — Town & Country RV Resort Skip to the content (813) 892-1474 Dade City, Florida Tampa 81 ° f Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact Book A Stay Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact About Town & Country OUR RESORT About Us Town and Country RV Resort is a seasonal 55+ community located four miles north of downtown Dade City amidst the rolling hills and Spanish moss covered oaks of Western Central Florida. We made it our goal to provide an RV resort that is well-maintained, enjoyable and beautiful for our guests. Family-owned and operated 35 shaded acres of land COMMUNITY Our History The Town and Country RV Resort was built in 1986. The Hawkins family purchased the Town and Country RV Resort in 2000, and the resort continues to be family owned and operated. Our 55+ R.V. resort is situated on 35 acres, complete with a driving range and pool. We work hard every day so you can safely enjoy your retirement years. Our Staff Our Lovely RV Resort in Dade City, FL Our little spot nestled on a hill in the lovely Florida countryside will offer you days full of activities, a strong sense of community, and companionship with your neighbors. Sunshine Sunshine is a great part of our focus here; dip in our relaxing heated pool or enjoy a walk on the 35 acres. Early risers will be able to catch sights of the most amazing birds in the area. Some refer to our park as a tropical oasis. Recreational Hall Our recreational hall offers books and puzzles for some independent entertainment or our social clubs host everything from shuffleboard tournaments, bingo, euchre, bridge, to dinners and dances. The fun is all here, you decide how much to have. Animals We have 13 open space acres in the rear of the park for dog-walking or exercising. Even if you don’t own an animal, you can spend a few restful moments saying hello to Susie, Wifi, Snowy and Baby, the Town & Country feline mascots. Prime Location Located in Dade City, only 5 miles from the nearest grocery stores, antiques shops, pharmacies, shopping centers and hospitals. We offer a country, slow-paced feel but provides residents the necessary amenities close to home. Tampa is less than an hour drive and Orlando is just over an hour away. Relaxation Paradise Enjoy your days relaxing on your porch, having coffee with friends at the recreation hall, golfing at the adjacent course, walking the park grounds or shopping in downtown Dade City. We also welcome vacationing families and overnight guests on their way in and out of town. Activities We offer an on-site driving range and a place to play bocce ball or corn hole. The Park Association puts on many activities during the year, including weekly social golf tournaments, weekly bingo and poker and monthly dances. There are also shuffleboard courts, horseshoe rings, a pool table and a swimming pool. We offer a wide variety of amenities for our guests. Every single one is serviced regularly and ready for use. VIEW ALL AMENITIES Come Stay With Us All Town & Country RV sites are full hook-up and have either 30 or 50 amp service (50 amp available on all sites).  All of our sites are very spacious at 75 feet long and we have no limitations on RV length. Pull through lots in the back can house RVs pulling trailers. Rules and Regulations — Town & Country RV Resort Skip to the content (813) 892-1474 Dade City, Florida Tampa 75 ° f Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact Book A Stay Home About About Us Our Staff Gallery Rental Details Resources Amenities Nearby Activities Resort Map Rules and Regulations Contact Rules and Regulations Town & Country RV Resort NOVEMBER 1, 2022, 
18005 U.S. 301
Dade City, FL 33523 1. No subletting allowed. 2. The sale or purchase of any Unit within this park must be approved by management prior to sale or purchase. Permission to sell your in-park RV Unit (Park model, park trailer, travel trailer, fifth wheel, motorhome) on lot rented in Town & Country RV Resort must be obtained from park management. RV units that are not in good condition, in violation of park rules, past due on lot rental payment, etc. will not be permitted to be sold and remain on lot. If permission is granted to sell RV unit and remain on lot, RV unit can be listed in the office, and the sale must be through the Town & Country RV Resort office management. No for sale signs will be permitted on RV Units in park. Any prospective purchaser must qualify by meeting the requirements of the park rules and regulations. 3. The park is not responsible for damage, injury, or loss by accident, theft, fire, an act of god, or any other cause whatsoever to either the property or person of any resident, guest or temporary visitor. Also, the park is not responsible or liable for any property damage or personal injury to adults or children resulting from the negligent use of park recreational facilities or equipment by park residents, guests, temporary visitors, or others. R.V. units (travel trailers, fifth wheels, park trailers, park models) sustaining irreparable damage from fire, act of god, falling trees or branches, etc. must be removed from lot and Town & Country RV Resort within 45 days or RV unit will be removed and disposed of by management at owner’s expense. 4. All persons who enter or live in park must comply with all applicable laws, ordinances and regulations of the city, county, and state. Failure to do so may result in the levying of an ordinance violation fee or eviction. 5. Retired adults, over 55 years of age only. Only two persons per unit. Guests must pay a guest fee per person, per night, for a maximum stay of two weeks. Unit owners must register their guests and pay their fees upon arrival. The owner of the unit must be present when guests are present. 6. No business activities shall be conducted within the park. This includes buying and selling or flipping of RV unit, motor vehicles, golf carts, sheds, etc. 7. Rates are subject to change without notice and there will be no refunds on deposits or rents. 8. No aggressive dogs allowed. Always clean up after your pet. Pets must be walked on dog walk or at rear of park, not on the park streets. Harassment of dog walkers will not be tolerated. Do not let dogs run loose in park or on lot. Dogs that bark continuously on lot or in RV Unit Will not be tolerated. 9. Respect others privacy and do not walk between homes. Mind your own business. 10. One (1) RV only per lot. On lot loading or unloading of additional RV. or utility trailer is permitted two (2) times per season, arrival and departure, 8 HR duration during daylight only. All other times must be in storage area. 11. Effective 11/1/2021, no additional sheds of any kind, concrete pavers or building onto RV Units is allowed. 12. Do not overload RV Lot with vegetation (Trees, bushes, ornamentals, etc). vegetation that impedes mowing, impedes visibility, etc. And encourages vermin will be removed by park management. 13. No large scale social events are allowed on RV Lots. Large social events are planned and sanctioned by the Town & Country social association and will take place at the rec building area, fire pit area and common ground/Pavillion area at rear of park. Large social events are limited to Town & Country RV Resort patrons only. All events are B.Y.O.B. and at your own risk. 14. The park recreation room is designed for private activities for registered RV Owners and registered guests only. The park is not responsible for any food served at gatherings. 15. Park management expects recreation room to be cleaned after functions or gatherings. Cleaning of the room includes removing decorations, putting clean tables and chairs back in original placement, mopping floor, and removing waste. Do not leave any food in the park refrigerator. 16. No smoking is allowed in the recreation room, laundry room, restrooms, or any indoor, park owned area. 17. Pool hours: 9AM-dusk Recreation room hours: 8AM-10PM Laundry room hours: 8AM-8PM. Doors are locked at 8PM. 18. Children must be supervised at all times around pool, laundry room, restrooms, shuffleboard court, and on park streets. No lifeguard is on duty. Swim at your own risk. Pool gate must be latched upon entering and when leaving pool area. Only registered patrons of Town & Country RV Resort are allowed to use pool. 19. Any old or rusting buildings or propane tanks must be painted or removed. 20. When RV units are vacated for the summer, all decorations, lawn ornaments, mowers, bikes, grills, furniture, clothes lines, and umbrellas must be stored out of sight. Store water hoses and turn off main water line. Nothing is to be left in yard. 21. Golf carts are permitted for transportation only around RV park. No joy riding, racing, or D.U.I. Operation is permitted. All golf carts must have working head and tail lights and carry liability insurance. All operators must have a driver’s license and obey stop signs and speed limits. No cutting through RV lots with golf carts. 22. Use of illegal drugs, marijuana smoking, disorderly conduct, reckless driving of motor vehicles, driving of motor vehicles in unauthorized areas, illegal activities of any kind and sexual harassment of any kind will not be tolerated and will result in eviction and removal of RV unit from park. 23. Vacuum breakers were installed on the hose bib by your electric meter. These breakers are required by the state of Florida health department and must remain on the water supply faucet. 24. The park dumpster is for household trash and garbage only. No appliances, tires, furniture, mattresses, l.P. Bottles, hazardous materials, or building and demolition refuse are to be put in park dumpster. These items must be taken to county transfer stations or recycling center. This is your responsibility! 25. Leaves and lawn clippings, etc. Will not be picked up by management. Take them to designated areas in rear of park. No plastic bags. 26. Please conserve water. Hand watering only. No sprinklers. 27. Trees-no trimming of trees without permission. Any trees planted by park management or RV Owners are not to be removed. Do not attach any objects to trees (No screws, nails, bolts, hooks, or satellite dishes). Park is not responsible for damage or injury from falling trees or branches. Management reserves the right to trim, move, or remove any tree in park. 28. Storage area – you must receive permission from park manager (Steve) before using park storage area. All motor vehicles, boats, trailers, and RV’s must have current registration. Management reserves the right to deny use of storage area. Storage fees apply. 29. All contractors, service men, RV Transporters, etc. must check in at the office before beginning work. Tampering with park utilities, water connections, valves, sewer connections and clean-outs, or electric services is strictly prohibited. Certificate of insurance is required. 30. Loud, boisterous, abusive language is strictly prohibited in park. No posting of derogatory signs, billboards, flags, or announcements are allowed anywhere on the park property. Management reserves the right to remove any of these. 31. Illegal drugs- sale or use of illegal drugs on park property is strictly prohibited. Sheriff’s office will be notified and person/persons will be evicted from park immediately. 32. Alcoholic beverages- consumption of alcoholic beverages on park property and at social functions is at your own risk. Vending of alcoholic beverages (free or sale), is strictly prohibited. Use of motor vehicles or golf carts while under the influence of alcohol is strictly prohibited. 33. Owners and management of Town & Country RV Resort will not be responsible for injury or loss from the use of alcoholic beverages. 34. Park recreational facilities and social functions are for registered tenants and registered guests only. No exceptions. 35. Driving range- use of driving range is at your own risk. Driven golf balls must be on ground by third marker. Do not drive golf balls if anyone or anything is on range or road to golf course. This includes runners, walkers, dog walkers, golf carts, maintenance equipment, etc. Please pick up the same number of golf balls you drive. 36. Unoccupied RV lots are not to be used for parking or dog walks. Do not encroach on unoccupied RV lots. 37. Insurance regulations prohibit us from loaning power and hand tools, ladders, etc. Please do not ask, we will have to say no. 38. Six-month lot rental rate- includes six months on lot storage, runs six consecutive months. Days cannot be transferred. You must register at office upon arrival. Six-month rate must be paid in full. In 1995, the Florida legislature passed laws governing the rights of RV Parks owners and RV Park residents. A copy of chapter 513 of the Florida statutes is on file in the park office for your inspection. Town & Country RV Resort is licensed with the state of Florida as an RV Park, license# 51-54-00264. All lots are rented, not owned. RV units (travel trailers, fifth wheels, park trailers and park models) are recreational vehicles, not real estate, and come under chapter 513 Florida statutes. 40. We live in our permanent home in an RV park in Zephyrhills we will be selling after having left California living there for half our lives, 30 yrs. We visited a yr ago and spoke to one of the handful of permanent residents who was very friendly and told us the owner had purchased a few homes from people who were unable to sell and perhaps he would rent out short term. A yr later we were coming back to look and today we would have been inquiring w the office. When we drove in, immediately there was a man in a white van following us. My husband pulled to the side. The man pulled up to our window scrutinizing us and asking what our business was. We proceeded to relay the above. He had tools galore in his van. He did not identify himself so I assumed he was either a protective nosy resident or a really protective maintenance man w his van and tools. He repeatedly said, in the brief 3 minute encounter, this place was seasonal. We said we were looking for seasonal (we will be transitioning w a 5th wheel). He proceeded to slowly leave to the end of the park. We sat there until he disappeared and proceeded to go down a few streets to view park like we did a yr ago. On our way out, we saw a man on a golf cart talking to a permanent resident at her home. We decided to stop and be polite. Much to our surprise it was now the same man on the golf cart. I asked what time office was open tomorrow, realizing mid sentence this was the same man. He proceeded with his negativity once more. Finally, out of frustration, but politely I asked him if he was the maintenance man. That was when he finally identified himself, showing his true colors in the process, saying he was the "OWNER and HE WANTED US OUT OF HERE AND I DONT WANT YOU iN HERE". Our jaws dropped along w the resident and we were stunned speechless. I am the daughter of a USAF pilot. My dad was a Christian, a righteous man and a man of noble character and inscrutable integrity. I later felt if he were there and heard this man talk to me and my husband, he would have decked him just once and laid him out for a good few hours. The only thing I can figure is that my husband of 33 yrs is of Hispanic descent and he doesn't want anyone who looks like him in his park. I cannot remember the last time, I or we were ever spoken to so nastily. He is a rude, nasty man who has probably spent a lifetime of inflicting his nastiness on whomever he deems his latest victims. I believe his caginess in never identifying himself was all about cleverly trying to discourage us from inquiring about a seasonal stay because of the color of my husband's skin. So, vacationer, snow bird, buyer of a park model 4 sale in there, BEWARE! This man is UNHINGED. He is either a RACIST, UNHINGED or BOTH. Thank GOD, we found out prior to a background check at the office with our flying colors credit scores, no criminal records ever, no evictions ever and history of always making our rent and bill payments on time for decades. Vic Newbold October 16, 2023 The male senior owner has issues that involve yelling at people and threatening them. I spent 1. And 1/2 winters but left as I did not feel safe there when he went off on me. I didn't know ihe was stable or if he would become more violent. His wife Mary was well aware of his outbursts P Stickney May 23, 2023 After four physical visits and numerous telephone calls, which were call forwarded an 813 area code, went to a recording saying that the mailbox was full, we have yet been able to get in touch with Mary. On our first visit the office was locked so we asked a man doing  some work there and he left her a note to call me. On our last visit the same man told me that this is not a trailer park it's an RV resort. Ok I'm using a RV he then said that that they don't rent out to RV people in the summer. Huh?. Something is , in my opinion, really weird going on here. We have been RV enthusiastic  people for 50 years and I can honestly say I have never encountered a stranger situation.  Totally surprised that they can maintain a business Carol Wotring November 30, 2021 Nice people. Unfortunately we haven't been able to get for a few years. Corn Hole Toss Gaining popularity with the RV park crowd, come out with your friends and toss those bean bags. Fire Pit Have bonfires in our fire pit and stay warm during the winter season. Pool Table Compete with park residents (some experts even bring their own cues)!
